title: International Court of Justice Issues Landmark Human Rights Ruling
introText: The International Court of Justice has issued a landmark ruling establishing new standards for state responsibility in human rights violations. The decision creates precedent for holding governments accountable for systematic abuses.

content.content: The ICJ ruled that states bear responsibility for human rights violations even when carried out by non-state actors under their effective control. The decision expands accountability for proxy conflicts and systematic persecution.
The ruling establishes that willful blindness to abuses does not shield states from responsibility. Governments must take affirmative steps to prevent violations within their sphere of influence.
Human rights organizations hailed the ruling as transformative. It provides legal foundation for future cases and strengthens deterrence against state-sponsored abuses.
